content:
See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail#w_understanding-gmail-labels-and-thunderbird-folders

It should also state Gmail presents imap folders for the labels in your gmail account. Thunderbird thinks Gmail is just another imap server.

As for only one copy of each message, according to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1554529#c12 this is not working.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Quick Update. I think I found the reason.

The back-bouncing email had no message body, just a subject line. Apparently, Spam Filter automatically throws messages with no body back into Spam Box even after it's told not to, and even if the sender address appears in the Collected Address book..
creator: jl11
